channel.title: CVE Feed for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr
channel.description: The latest CVEs for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr

item.title: CVE-2020-13600|2024-08-04T12:25:16.152Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Malformed SPI in response for eswifi can corrupt kernel memory. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.3.0 contain Heap-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-122). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-hx4p-j86p-2mhr

item.title: CVE-2020-10021|2024-08-04T10:50:57.832Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Out-of-bounds Write in the USB Mass Storage memoryWrite handler with unaligned Sizes See NCC-ZEP-024, NCC-ZEP-025, NCC-ZEP-026 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.1 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10065|2024-08-04T10:50:57.944Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Missing Size Checks in Bluetooth HCI over SPI. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency (CWE-130). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-hg2w-62p6-g67c

item.title: CVE-2020-10063|2024-08-04T10:50:57.842Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A remote adversary with the ability to send arbitrary CoAP packets to be parsed by Zephyr is able to cause a denial of service. This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-13599|2024-08-04T12:25:15.886Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Security problem with settings and littlefs. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.3.0 contain Incorrect Default Permissions (CWE-276). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-5qhg-j6wc-4f6q

item.title: CVE-2020-13598|2024-08-04T12:25:16.105Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: FS: Buffer Overflow when enabling Long File Names in FAT_FS and calling fs_stat. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.3.0 contain Stack-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-121). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-7fhv-rgxr-x56h

item.title: CVE-2020-13602|2024-08-04T12:25:16.207Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Remote Denial of Service in LwM2M do_write_op_tlv. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.2.0 contain Improper Input Validation (CWE-20), Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop') (CWE-835). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-g9mg-fj58-6fqh

item.title: CVE-2020-13603|2024-08-04T12:25:16.446Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Integer Overflow in memory allocating functions. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.4.0 contain Integer Overflow or Wraparound (CWE-190). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-94vp-8gc2-rm45

item.title: CVE-2020-10072|2024-08-04T10:50:57.866Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges in zephyr. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges (CWE-280). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-vf79-hqwm-w4xc

item.title: CVE-2020-10061|2024-08-04T10:50:57.865Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Improper handling of the full-buffer case in the Zephyr Bluetooth implementation can result in memory corruption. This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions, and version 1.14.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10059|2024-08-04T10:50:57.794Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The UpdateHub module disables DTLS peer checking, which allows for a man in the middle attack. This is mitigated by firmware images requiring valid signatures. However, there is no benefit to using DTLS without the peer checking. See NCC-ZEP-018 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10024|2024-08-04T10:50:57.859Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The arm platform-specific code uses a signed integer comparison when validating system call numbers. An attacker who has obtained code execution within a user thread is able to elevate privileges to that of the kernel. See NCC-ZEP-001 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.0 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10022|2024-08-04T10:50:57.286Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malformed JSON payload that is received from an UpdateHub server may trigger memory corruption in the Zephyr OS. This could result in a denial of service in the best case, or code execution in the worst case. See NCC-NCC-016 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions. version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10062|2024-08-04T10:50:57.812Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An off-by-one error in the Zephyr project MQTT packet length decoder can result in memory corruption and possible remote code execution. NCC-ZEP-031 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10070|2024-08-04T10:50:57.848Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: In the Zephyr Project MQTT code, improper bounds checking can result in memory corruption and possibly remote code execution. NCC-ZEP-031 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10060|2024-08-04T10:50:57.868Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: In updatehub_probe, right after JSON parsing is complete, objects\[1] is accessed from the output structure in two different places. If the JSON contained less than two elements, this access would reference unitialized stack memory. This could result in a crash, denial of service, or possibly an information leak. Provided the fix in CVE-2020-10059 is applied, the attack requires compromise of the server. See NCC-ZEP-030 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions. version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10066|2024-08-04T10:50:57.855Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Incorrect Error Handling in Bluetooth HCI core. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain NULL Pointer Dereference (CWE-476). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-gc66-xfrc-24qr

item.title: CVE-2020-10067|2024-08-04T10:50:57.798Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious userspace application can cause a integer overflow and bypass security checks performed by system call handlers. The impact would depend on the underlying system call and can range from denial of service to information leak to memory corruption resulting in code execution within the kernel. See NCC-ZEP-005 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.1 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10064|2024-08-04T10:50:57.856Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Improper Input Frame Validation in ieee802154 Processing. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain Stack-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-121), Heap-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-122). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-3gvq-h42f-v3c7

item.title: CVE-2020-13601|2024-08-04T12:25:16.255Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible read out of bounds in dns read. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.3.0 contain Out-of-bounds Read (CWE-125). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-mm57-9hqw-qh44

item.title: CVE-2020-10028|2024-08-04T10:50:57.804Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Multiple syscalls with insufficient argument validation See NCC-ZEP-006 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.0 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10068|2024-08-04T10:50:57.859Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: In the Zephyr project Bluetooth subsystem, certain duplicate and back-to-back packets can cause incorrect behavior, resulting in a denial of service. This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions, and version 1.14.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10019|2024-08-04T10:50:57.278Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: USB DFU has a potential buffer overflow where the requested length (wLength) is not checked against the buffer size. This could be used by a malicious USB host to exploit the buffer overflow. See NCC-ZEP-002 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.1 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10023|2024-08-04T10:50:57.782Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The shell subsystem contains a buffer overflow, whereby an adversary with physical access to the device is able to cause a memory corruption, resulting in denial of service or possibly code execution within the Zephyr kernel. See NCC-NCC-019 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.0 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10058|2024-08-04T10:50:57.801Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Multiple syscalls in the Kscan subsystem perform insufficient argument validation, allowing code executing in userspace to potentially gain elevated privileges. See NCC-ZEP-006 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10027|2024-08-04T10:50:57.928Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An attacker who has obtained code execution within a user thread is able to elevate privileges to that of the kernel. See NCC-ZEP-001 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.0 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10071|2024-08-04T10:50:57.813Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The Zephyr MQTT parsing code performs insufficient checking of the length field on publish messages, allowing a buffer overflow and potentially remote code execution. NCC-ZEP-031 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10069|2024-08-04T10:50:57.810Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Zephyr Bluetooth unchecked packet data results in denial of service. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain Improper Handling of Parameters (CWE-233). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-f6vh-7v4x-8fjp

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-08-02T08:42:07.169Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-08-02T08:21:18.165Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2023-7060|2024-08-02T08:50:07.968Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Zephyr OS IP packet handling does not properly drop IP packets arriving on an external interface with a source address equal to 127.0.01 or the destination address.

item.title: CVE-2023-5779|2024-08-02T08:07:32.855Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: can: out of bounds in remove_rx_filter function

item.title: CVE-2023-6881|2024-08-02T08:42:08.232Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in is_mount_point

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-08-01T20:05:08.484Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-08-01T18:48:21.828Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-07-26T15:24:08.412Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T18:00:13.536Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2023-5779|2024-02-18T07:46:41.927Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: can: out of bounds in remove_rx_filter function

item.title: CVE-2023-7060|2024-06-04T17:17:29.040Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Zephyr OS IP packet handling does not properly drop IP packets arriving on an external interface with a source address equal to 127.0.01 or the destination address.

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-02-18T07:04:36.321Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-02-18T07:27:13.399Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2023-6881|2024-06-04T17:17:04.296Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in is_mount_point

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-02-19T21:19:51.915Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-06-04T17:31:38.524Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T16:44:28.197Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-07-05T17:20:57.320Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-07-29T15:19:42.376Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-08-01T19:32:42.668Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet
